intro: Cirsium lipskyi, commonly known as the Lipsky thistle, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with spiny, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its purple to pinkish flowers appear in late summer, and the plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils. Cirsium lipskyi is often found in alpine and steppe habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
